name: Fudgy Brownies
description: These brownies are the ultimate indulgence — rich, fudgy, and deeply chocolatey with that irresistible crackly top. Every bite melts in your mouth, with a gooey center and just the right hint of chew at the edges. Whether you're baking for a crowd or just treating yourself, this recipe delivers bakery-style brownies that feel like a warm hug in dessert form.
credit: Recipe originally by Rachel Farnsworth of the Stay at Home Chef.

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a 9x9-inch metal baking pan with parchment paper.

Melt 141 g salted butter in the microwave in a micrwoave-safe bowl in 20-second increments until fully melted. Pour into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in 207 g granulated sugar by hand until smooth, 30 seconds.
Add in 2 eggs and 10 mL vanilla extract. Whisk vigorously for 1 minute to ensure a crackly top.
Melt 114 g chocolate chips in a microwave in 30-second increments, stirring between each. Once melted and smooth, whisk into the brownie batter until combined and smooth.
Use a rubber spatula to stir in 99 g all-purpose flour, 24 g unsweetened cocoa powder, and 0.5 teaspoon salt until just combined. Stir in whole, unmelted chocolate chips.
Pour into prepared pan and smooth out.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs.
Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for at least 30 minutes .
Top with flaky sea salt and let cool before slicing into 9 squares.
